titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Consumer Reports. Editorial Department records, 1934-2015, bulk 1936-1997 RL.11863
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-12-10 09:05:29 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Consumer Reports is a product testing and consumer advocacy nonprofit organization based in Yonkers, N.Y., founded in 1936. The Editorial Department is responsible for the production of the organization's serial publications and promotional literature. The Editorial Department records include biographical information, corporate anniversary planning documents, correspondence, publication drafts, research and investigative materials, texts of speeches and testimonies, and other printed materials. The collection also contains office files of several Editors and departmental directors, including Dexter Masters, Donal Dinwiddie, and Mildred Brady. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: Administrative Files; Consultants; Directors and Editors; Publication Production Files.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Consumer Reports is a product testing and consumer advocacy nonprofit organization based in Yonkers, N.Y., founded in 1936. The Editorial Department is responsible for the production of the organization's serial publications and promotional literature.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Consumer Reports. Editorial Department records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2019.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Consumer Reports. Editorial Department records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Richard Collier, Dec. 2020; Accessions described in this collection guide: 2019-0130.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:
Consumer Reports. Board of Directors records;
Consumer Reports. Colston E. Warne papers

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Editorial Department records include biographical information, corporate anniversary planning documents, correspondence, publication drafts, research and investigative materials, texts of speeches and testimonies, and other printed materials. The collection also contains office files of several Editors and departmental directors, including Dexter Masters, Donal Dinwiddie, and Mildred Brady.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Known by the initials TNT, it was an anti-union organization led by one Bessie Ochs, a California activist, in 1937. It disbanded in 1940 upon investigation by the LaFollette Committee and the U.S. Justice Department. Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Neutral_Thousands

Report on Two Leading Makes of "Custom-Built" Radio Receivers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, letters from readers, subject files, drafts and proof copies of articles, booklets and other printed materials.
